subtitle: Make your baby laugh
title: 4 months old
content:
Created by BabyCenter 

Your baby is changing quickly. She can make basic sounds. She may even say something that sounds like ‘Ma-ma’ this month! Don't worry if she doesn't. All babies develop at different rates. 

So far, she has needed your full-time attention.  Now she may be happy amusing herself sometimes. You may find her happily playing with her hands and feet! 

At this age, it is good for your baby to be with loved ones or trusted friends. As she grows, your baby will need to learn social skills and how to interact with others. Your family will love having a cuddle! You can give her lots of cuddles when you get back.	

Even though crying is still your baby's best form of communication, she is also getting a sense of humour. Play peek-a-boo with her. See if she laughs when your face appears from under a blanket. 

At this age, if he is on his belly, he may lift up his head and shoulders, using his arms for support.  Your baby may even be able to roll over from his front to his back. Encourage him by jiggling a toy on the side he usually rolls to. Clap and smile when he does!
